page.title: 08The Old Buildings Of Corston
page.content: We were shown around the village by{Mr. Ted Jones,}who has lived in Corston for{forty-nine years.}Most of the houses are built around the main road, or the coaching road as it is called. There was a quarry down Common Road, but the poor quality stone was used to fill in the old roads. Better building stone came from near by Rodbourne. Many of the buildings have changed their use. The{Old Bell Inn, {closed after World War l,}the post office and mill, built in 1565, are now houses. The mill leat has been filled in .{The Zion Chapel built in {1857}has also been converted into a house and the graveyard into a garden. There is also another disused chapel which is in ruins and it's grounds overgrown.
